methods.Synopsis: This method allows you to create a new user, with the purpose of returning a unique user_id and API key which must be used in all subsequent requests for this user.

parameters.Name: user_name
parameters.Description: unique user name to identify this user

parameters.Name: password
parameters.Description: password for this user

parameters.Name: email_address
parameters.Description: valid contact email address

parameters.Name: firstname
parameters.Description: first name of the user

parameters.Name: lastname
parameters.Description: surname of the user

parameters.Name: address1
parameters.Description: first line of the user's address

parameters.Name: address2
parameters.Description: second line of the user's address

parameters.Name: address3
parameters.Description: third line of the user's address

parameters.Name: address4
parameters.Description: fourth line of the user's address

parameters.Name: postcode
parameters.Description: postcode/zipcode of the user's address

parameters.Name: country
parameters.Type: must be taken from the Country reference table
parameters.Description: 2 letter ISO country code

parameters.Name: phone
parameters.Description: telephone contact of the user

parameters.Name: fax
parameters.Description: fax number of the user

parameters.Name: skype
parameters.Description: skype username of the user

parameters.Name: msn
parameters.Description: msn username of the user

parameters.Name: aim
parameters.Description: aim username of the user

parameters.Name: signup_ip
parameters.Description: the ip address of the user who is signing up

parameters.Name: format
parameters.Description: Output format as JSON or XML

methods.Synopsis: This method allows you to create a new advertiser, with the purpose of returning a unique advertiser_id which must be used in all subsequent requests for advertiser related methods.

parameters.Description: unique account name to identify this advertiser

parameters.Name: company_name
parameters.Description: the official company name for the advertiser

parameters.Name: address1
parameters.Description: first line of the advertiser's address

parameters.Name: postcode
parameters.Description: postcode/zipcode of the advertiser's address

parameters.Name: country
parameters.Description: 2 letter ISO country code

parameters.Name: phone
parameters.Description: telephone contact of the advertiser

parameters.Name: signup_ip
parameters.Description: the ip address of the user who is signing up

parameters.Name: address2
parameters.Description: second line of the advertiser's address

parameters.Name: address3
parameters.Description: third line of the advertiser's address

parameters.Name: address4
parameters.Description: fourth line of the advertiser's address

parameters.Name: vat_number
parameters.Description: the VAT number (or related) for the advertiser

parameters.Name: format
parameters.Description: Output format as JSON or XML

parameters.Description: the VAT number (or related) for the advertiser

methods.MethodName: View the details of an advertiser
methods.Synopsis: This method allows you to view the details of an existing advertiser.

parameters.Description: unique advertiser id that you wish to view

methods.Synopsis: This method allows you to view the campaign(s) that belong to an advertiser.

parameters.Name: advertiser_id
parameters.Description: unique advertiser id

parameters.Name: format
parameters.Description: Output format as JSON or XML

methods.Synopsis: This method allows you to create a new campaign, with the purpose of returning a unique campaign_id which must be used in all subsequent requests for this campaign.

parameters.Name: advertiser_id
parameters.Description: The advertiser id to whom the campaign belongs

parameters.Name: title
parameters.Description: Title of the campaign

parameters.Name: type
parameters.Description: The type of campaign

parameters.Name: tracking_method
parameters.Description: The tracking method employed by the campaign

parameters.Name: vertical_id
parameters.Description: The id of the main vertical which the campaign is related to

parameters.Name: reporting_timezone
parameters.Description: The relevant reporting timezone for the campaign which will dictate the timezone of the reporting

parameters.Name: destination_url
parameters.Description: Default redirect destination for the campaign

parameters.Name: default_currency
parameters.Description: The default currency of the campaign

parameters.Name: cookie_period
parameters.Description: Default cookie period, which measures the maximum amount of time, in seconds, between a click and a conversion

parameters.Name: multiple_conversions_per_click
parameters.Description: Defines whether 1 click can be responsible for multiple conversions

parameters.Name: unique_conversion_refs
parameters.Description: Defines whether to automatically reject conversions which pass a conversionref already seen on a previous conversion

parameters.Name: auto_approve_publisher
parameters.Description: Defines whether publishers who apply to join the campaign will be automatically accepted

parameters.Name: allow_deep_linking
parameters.Description: Defines whether publishers are allowed to override the default destination URL of the campaign to redirect traffic to a custom location

parameters.Name: default_commission_rate
parameters.Description: The % of commission awarded based on the value of the conversion

parameters.Name: default_commission_value
parameters.Description: The number of days grace, where the status of an approved conversion item can be changed

parameters.Name: restricted_deep_linking
parameters.Description: Determines whether the user can deeplink to a domain which does not match the default_destination

parameters.Name: extra_restricted_deep_linking_domains
parameters.Description: A comma separated list of extra domains to include in the restricted_deep_linking checks

parameters.Name: append_url_parameters
parameters.Description: Defines a string to be appended to all publisher links to advertiser location

parameters.Name: prepend_url_string
parameters.Description: Defines a string to be prepended to all publisher links to advertiser location

parameters.Name: auto_rejected_ips
parameters.Description: A comma separated list of ip addresses which will auto reject conversions

parameters.Name: ip_tracking_time
parameters.Description: The time in seconds, to allow ip matching of conversions to clicks

parameters.Name: associated_campaigns
parameters.Description: A comma separated list of campaign id(s) to use for cross tracking

parameters.Name: description
parameters.Description: A text based description of the campaign

parameters.Name: campaign_logo
parameters.Description: The URL of a logo for the campaign

parameters.Name: terms
parameters.Description: Defines a set of custom terms and conditions for the campaign, to which publishers must agree before they can be approved onto the campaign

parameters.Name: default_override
parameters.Description: The default override for the campaign

parameters.Name: week_start
parameters.Description: The day you wish the system to consider the first of the week

parameters.Name: conversion_type
parameters.Description: The type of campaign, affiliate (sale) or leadgen (lead)

parameters.Name: hidden_campaign
parameters.Description: Hide the campaign from publishers not participating

parameters.Name: force_approve_period
parameters.Description: Period in days after which all pending items are auto-approved

parameters.Name: invoice_contact
parameters.Description: Person to contact RE: invoices

parameters.Name: invoice_company
parameters.Description: Company to whom invoices are addressed

parameters.Name: invoice_address_1
parameters.Description: Specify an invoice address (if not the default address)

parameters.Name: invoice_address_2
parameters.Description: Specify an invoice address (if not the default address)

parameters.Name: invoice_address_3
parameters.Description: Specify an invoice address (if not the default address)

parameters.Name: invoice_address_4
parameters.Description: Specify an invoice address (if not the default address)

parameters.Name: invoice_address_postcode
parameters.Description: Specify an invoice address (if not the default address)

parameters.Name: invoice_address_country
parameters.Description: Specify an invoice address (if not the default address)

parameters.Name: invoice_only
parameters.Description: Limits invoicing to only the field specified

parameters.Name: dont_invoice
parameters.Description: Deactivate invoicing

parameters.Name: deferred_lead_submission
parameters.Description: Skips lead submission process (leads will not be sent to brokers)

parameters.Name: pay_publisher_directly
parameters.Description: Set the campaign as paying publisher directly. The advertiser must pay directly.

parameters.Name: allow_third_party_pixel
parameters.Description: Allow publishers to fire their own conversion pixels

parameters.Name: budget_summary_interval
parameters.Description: How often budget warnings will be generated (in hours)

parameters.Name: budget_summary_start_time
parameters.Description: The hour of the day on which the first budget summary will be generated

parameters.Name: lead_confirmation_url_success
parameters.Description: Redirection url for a successful lead

parameters.Name: lead_confirmation_url_fail
parameters.Description: Redirection url for a failed lead

parameters.Name: commissions
parameters.Description: Commission points to be applied to campaign

parameters.Name: default_destination
parameters.Description: Default redirection destination

parameters.Name: default_currency
parameters.Description: Default currency for the campaign

parameters.Name: tracking_method
parameters.Description: Pixel, server to server or api tracking

parameters.Name: allow_deep_linking
parameters.Description: Enable deep linking

parameters.Name: cookie_period
parameters.Description: Cookie period for a campaign (in seconds)

parameters.Name: multiple_conversions_per_click
parameters.Description: Allow multiple conversions per click

parameters.Name: unique_conversion_refs
parameters.Description: Enable the automatic rejection of duplicates

parameters.Name: auto_rejected_ips
parameters.Description: List of IP address that will auto-reject conversions

parameters.Name: retire_reason
parameters.Description: This field is used to describe the reason the campaign was retired

parameters.Name: post_impression_tracking
parameters.Description: Enables post impression tracking

parameters.Name: campaign_budget
parameters.Description: The budget for the campaign

parameters.Name: auto_approve_publisher
parameters.Description: Publishers should be automatically approved onto the campaign

parameters.Name: lead_form_visible_publishers
parameters.Description: Flag to designate whether or not lead form is made available to publishers

parameters.Name: robot_click_record
parameters.Description: How to handle clicks detected as being from robots

parameters.Name: creative_remote_hosting
parameters.Description: Allow remote hosting of creatives

parameters.Name: format
parameters.Description: Output format as JSON or XML

methods.MethodName: View the details of a campaign
methods.Synopsis: This method allows you to view the details of an existing campaign.

parameters.Name: campaign_id
parameters.Description: The campaign id of the campaign you are editing

parameters.Name: format
parameters.Description: Output format as JSON or XML

methods.Synopsis: This method allows you to delete/retire an unwanted campaign.

parameters.Name: campaign_id
parameters.Description: The campaign id of the campaign you are deleting

parameters.Name: action
parameters.Description: Specify the action you wish to take

parameters.Name: retire_reason
parameters.Description: Give a reason for the campaign to be retired

parameters.Name: format
parameters.Description: Output format as JSON or XML

methods.Synopsis: This method allows you to create new commission points.

parameters.Name: campaign_id
parameters.Description: The id of the campaign to which the commission belongs

parameters.Name: commission_level
parameters.Description: The level at which this commission point should be applied

parameters.Name: reference_id
parameters.Description: The id of the group/item to which the commission point is applied

parameters.Name: category
parameters.Description: The category code of an item

parameters.Name: sku
parameters.Description: The individual product code of an item

parameters.Name: customer_type
parameters.Description: The type of customer involved in the conversion

parameters.Name: override
parameters.Description: The override is the % of the commission awarded to the network for each conversion. Leave blank to default to the campaign's default override.

parameters.Name: override_type
parameters.Description: The default of "override" suggests that the rate or value you pass for the commission to be allocated is literal. "modify" will act as a calculation against the campaign default rate or value.

parameters.Name: start_date_time
parameters.Description: A specific start date may be specified which will determine when the commission will become active

parameters.Name: end_date_time
parameters.Description: A specific end date may be specified which will determine when the commission will become inactive

parameters.Name: update_description
parameters.Description: Provide a explanation for the commission update, for future reference

parameters.Name: commission_rate
parameters.Description: The % of commission to award based on the conversion value

parameters.Name: commission_value
parameters.Description: The fixed amount of commission to award, the default currency set in campaign is used

parameters.Name: format
parameters.Description: Output format as JSON or XML

methods.Synopsis: This method allows you to create new commission points.

parameters.Name: campaign_id
parameters.Description: The id of the campaign to which the commission belongs

parameters.Name: commission_id
parameters.Description: The id of the commission to update

parameters.Name: commission_level
parameters.Description: The level at which this commission point should be applied

parameters.Name: reference_id
parameters.Description: The id of the group/item to which the commission point is applied

parameters.Name: category
parameters.Description: The category code of an item

parameters.Name: sku
parameters.Description: The individual product code of an item

parameters.Name: customer_type
parameters.Description: The type of customer involved in the conversion

parameters.Name: override
parameters.Description: The override is the % of the commission awarded to the network for each conversion. Leave blank to default to the campaign's default override.

parameters.Name: override_type
parameters.Description: The default of "override" suggests that the rate or value you pass for the commission to be allocated is literal. "modify" will act as a calculation against the campaign default rate or value.

parameters.Name: start_date_time
parameters.Description: A specific start date may be specified which will determine when the commission will become active

parameters.Name: end_date_time
parameters.Description: A specific end date may be specified which will determine when the commission will become inactive

parameters.Name: update_description
parameters.Description: Provide a explanation for the commission update, for future reference

parameters.Name: commission_rate
parameters.Description: The % of commission to award based on the conversion value

parameters.Name: commission_value
parameters.Description: The fixed amount of commission to award, the default currency set in campaign is used

parameters.Name: format
parameters.Description: Output format as JSON or XML

methods.MethodName: View the details of an existing commission
methods.Synopsis: This method allows you to all campaign commissions, or specify a single commission to view.

parameters.Name: campaign_id
parameters.Description: The id of the campaign to which the commission belongs

parameters.Name: commission_level
parameters.Description: Filter the query by the commission level

parameters.Name: reference_id
parameters.Description: Filter by commission group id, publisher id or voucher code id

parameters.Name: active
parameters.Description: This method allows you to all campaign commissions, or specify a single commission to view.

parameters.Name: format
parameters.Description: Output format as JSON or XML

methods.Synopsis: This method allows you to create new commission groups.

parameters.Name: name
parameters.Description: Choose a name for the commission group

parameters.Name: description
parameters.Description: A description of the commission group

parameters.Name: campaign_id
parameters.Description: The id of the campaign to which the commission belongs

parameters.Name: start_date_time
parameters.Description: A specific start date may be specified which will determine when the commission will become active

parameters.Name: end_date_time
parameters.Description: A specific end date may be specified which will determine when the commission will become inactive

parameters.Name: publishers
parameters.Description: A list of publishers to add to the commission group, nested in an array

parameters.Name: format
parameters.Description: Output format as JSON or XML

methods.Synopsis: You can update any commission groups, in order to add and remove publishers, and change the other attributes.

parameters.Name: campaign_id
parameters.Description: The id of the campaign to which the commission belongs

parameters.Name: commission_id
parameters.Description: The id of the commission to update

parameters.Name: name
parameters.Description: Choose a name for the commission group

parameters.Name: description
parameters.Description: A description of the commission group

parameters.Name: start_date_time
parameters.Description: A specific date and time when the group will be active

parameters.Name: end_date_time
parameters.Description: A date and time when the group will become inactive

parameters.Name: publishers
parameters.Description: A list of publishers to add to the commission group, nested in an array

parameters.Name: format
parameters.Description: Output format as JSON or XML

methods.MethodName: View the details of existing commission groups
methods.Synopsis: This method allows you to all campaign commissions, or specify a single commission to view.

parameters.Name: campaign_id
parameters.Description: The id of the campaign to which the commission group belongs

parameters.Name: commission_group_id
parameters.Description: Select a specific commission group

parameters.Name: format
parameters.Description: Output format as JSON or XML

methods.Synopsis: This method allows you to create a new voucher, the API will return a new voucher code ID which can be used in subsequent requests to view or modify the voucher.

parameters.Name: voucher_code
parameters.Description: A name for the voucher code

parameters.Name: campaign_id
parameters.Description: ID of the campaign to which the voucher is associated

parameters.Name: description
parameters.Description: A description of the voucher code

parameters.Name: active
parameters.Description: Declare whether or not the voucher is active

parameters.Name: start_date_time
parameters.Description: Specify when the voucher will become active

parameters.Name: end_date_time
parameters.Description: Specify when the voucher will become inactive

parameters.Name: on_expiry
parameters.Description: What to do with commissions when the voucher expires

parameters.Name: on_invalid_user
parameters.Description: What to do when a user is invalid

parameters.Name: commission_groups
parameters.Description: The commission groups to which the voucher is applied

parameters.Name: format
parameters.Description: Output format as JSON or XML

methods.Synopsis: This method allows you to update an existing voucher.

parameters.Name: voucher_code_id
parameters.Description: A name for the voucher code

parameters.Name: campaign_id
parameters.Description: ID of the campaign to which the voucher is associated

parameters.Name: voucher_code
parameters.Description: A name for the voucher code

parameters.Name: description
parameters.Description: A description of the voucher code

parameters.Name: active
parameters.Description: Declare whether or not the voucher is active

parameters.Name: start_date_time
parameters.Description: Specify when the voucher will become active

parameters.Name: end_date_time
parameters.Description: Specify when the voucher will become inactive

parameters.Name: on_expiry
parameters.Description: What to do with commissions when the voucher expires

parameters.Name: on_invalid_user
parameters.Description: What to do when a user is invalid

parameters.Name: commission_groups
parameters.Description: The commission groups to which this voucher is applied

parameters.Name: format
parameters.Description: Output format as JSON or XML

methods.MethodName: View the details of an existing voucher code
methods.Synopsis: This method allows you to grab the details of vouchers associated with a campaign.

parameters.Name: campaign_id
parameters.Description: Campaign ID.

parameters.Name: format
parameters.Description: Output format as JSON or XML

methods.MethodName: Add update and remove publishers to or from a campaign
methods.Synopsis: This method allows you to add publishers to a campaign or remove them. The publishers must be contained within an array, this allows you to update the status of multiple publishers within one API call.

parameters.Name: campaign_id
parameters.Description: The id of the campaign to add the publisher to

parameters.Name: publisher_id
parameters.Description: The id of the publisher to be added

parameters.Name: campaign_status
parameters.Description: The status to allocate the publisher

parameters.Name: format
parameters.Description: Output format as JSON or XML

methods.Synopsis: This method allows you to view all of the publishers attached to a campaign. You may further filter the output by passing the campaign status of the publishers you wish to search for.

parameters.Name: campaign_id
parameters.Description: id of the campaign to which the publishers relate

parameters.Name: campaign_status
parameters.Description: Verbose status of campaign status to search for

parameters.Name: format
parameters.Description: Output format as JSON or XML

methods.Synopsis: This method allows you to create a new creative, which will allow you to add individual items of a matching type and/or dimensions.

parameters.Name: campaign_id
parameters.Description: The id of the campaign to which the creative belongs

parameters.Name: creative_type_id
parameters.Description: The type of the item which will reside in the creative

parameters.Name: creative_items
parameters.Description: At least 1 item must be added to the creative on creation, each item is placed within this array

parameters.Name: description
parameters.Description: The description of the creative group

parameters.Name: destination
parameters.Description: A HTTP URI may be specified, which will override the standard destination of the campaign

parameters.Name: start_date_time
parameters.Description: A specific start date may be specified which will determine when the group will become active

parameters.Name: end_date_time
parameters.Description: TA specific end date may be specified which will determine when the group will become inactive

parameters.Name: format
parameters.Description: Output format as JSON or XML

methods.Synopsis: This method allows you to update specific details of a creative group, and to add new creative items into an existing group.

parameters.Name: campaign_id
parameters.Description: The id of the campaign to which the creative belongs

parameters.Name: creative_id
parameters.Description: The id of the creative which is being updated

parameters.Name: creative_items
parameters.Description: At least 1 item must be added to the creative on creation, each item is placed within this array

parameters.Name: description
parameters.Description: The description of the creative group

parameters.Name: destination

methods.Synopsis: This method allows you to create a new publisher, with the purpose of returning a unique publisher_id which must be used in all subsequent requests for publisher related methods.

parameters.Name: account_name
parameters.Description: The unique account name to identify this publisher

parameters.Name: reporting_timezone
parameters.Description: The relevant reporting timezone for the publisher which will dictate the timezone of the reporting

parameters.Name: vertical
parameters.Description: The id of the main vertical which the publisher is involved with

parameters.Name: promotional_method
parameters.Description: The id of the predominant method the publisher uses to generate conversions

parameters.Name: terms_and_conditions
parameters.Description: The id of the latest terms and conditions shown to the publisher

parameters.Name: signup_ip
parameters.Description: The current ip address of the publisher who is signing up

parameters.Name: is_affiliate_user
parameters.Description: Determines whether the publisher is involved in affiliate activity

parameters.Name: is_lead_user
parameters.Description: Determines whether the publisher is involved in leadgen activity

parameters.Name: contact_email
parameters.Description: A contact email address of the publisher, if none is defined, the email of the user creating the publisher will be used

parameters.Name: company_name
parameters.Description: The official company name for the publisher

parameters.Name: vat_number
parameters.Description: The VAT number (or relative based on location) for the publisher

parameters.Name: description
parameters.Description: A short description of the publisher

parameters.Name: operating_country
parameters.Description: 2 letter ISO country code of the main operating country of the publisher

parameters.Name: foreign_identifier
parameters.Description: A foreign identifier for the publisher, such as an internal user id

parameters.Name: network_notes
parameters.Description: Store some notes on the network

parameters.Name: format
parameters.Description: Output format as JSON or XML
